intro: Grindelia lambertii, commonly known as Lambert's gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its gray-green, fuzzy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into bristly seed heads. Grindelia lambertii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low rainfall.
